alert.note: Alert for Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 9:56AM CST until January 31 at 10:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tangipahoa River At Osyka affecting Pike County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Amite, Robert...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tangipahoa River At Osyka. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pastures and woodlands along with some crop land near the river will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 15.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.6 feet on 10/28/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
